channel.title: Custom area i made real quick
channel.description: Nothing planned for it just finished testing it out, its on a pi [img]http://i.imgur.com/EuR6sr8.png[/img]

item.title: Custom area i made real quick
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:91, topic:522041”]https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/43697288/deob_renamer.zip

client must be deobbed first.
not sure what revisions it works up to[/quote]

I don’t generally use deobbed clients, but I dled it anyways.

Read full topic
item.source: Custom area i made real quick

item.title: Custom area i made real quick
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

It’s best practice to rename your client yourself manually so that you are fully aware of what each variable does. You’ll gain a great understanding and knowledge of the client, too.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom area i made real quick
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:89, topic:522041”][quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=640550.msg4329876#msg4329876 date=1373494769]

Better then aBoolean#

not everything is renamed, but almost

Speaking of renaming, I have some sort of a ‘renamer’ that automatically renames for me. Its for my 474.

I have that too, it’s called Eclipse.
[/quote]you have to know what the method/variable is doing to think of a decent name for it. the tool he is referring to already has a reference table to convert obfuscated variables/methods into a more understandable name.[/quote]

Oh that’s fancy. You gonna share that?

Read full topic

item.title: Custom area i made real quick
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“asshole_rule, post:83, topic:522041”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=640550.msg4329389#msg4329389 date=1373455134]
on the topic of walkable maps…
I found this in my client’s ObjectDef.java…
Is this some form of a troll, like seriously, who names it this?:
isUnWalkable = true;
[/quote]

You’re client must be a bit more renamed then mine, because I don’t have that. My objectDef is probably ~30% renamed, everything else is still horribly named (aBoolean, anInt, ect…)[/quote]
Yeah. The person that worked on this client. idk what the hell they were thinking, 90% of the naming isn’t like ANY other client. So when I go to add just about anything in, I have to edit it’s name or something so it works correctly.

Read full topic

Is this some form of a troll, like seriously, who names it this?:
isUnWalkable = true;[/quote]

item.source: Custom area i made real quick

item.title: Custom area i made real quick
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“hadlich4, post:78, topic:522041”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=640550.msg4329217#msg4329217 date=1373420135]

[quote author=asshole_rule link=topic=640550.msg4329214#msg4329214 date=1373419788][quote author=hadlich4 link=topic=640550.msg4328590#msg4328590 date=1373342127]
Lol. Reading all this makes me laugh. i like to see all you all arguing about this although if you know another way to make a custom map for PI using a program etc. why don’t you show us how you do it and by “you” i mean the few who say they know a better way of doing this.
[/quote]

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

This isn’t using a program, it’s using actual code created by me, and already in the 317 client. It may not be completely customizable, but it’s definitely custom.

If I knew how to model, I could make some way cooler stuff.
[/quote]

Hadlich before you say “that doesn’t work with PI”, it uses a packet in the 317 client.
[/quote]

lol to be honest i didnt even view this i looked at it and thought it was a link to a 317 map editor haha, but i mean using this method could you even make your own custom walls and such? and also it looks really sloppy in my opinion with how the maps are seperated. just my opinion.[/quote]

It’s the same principle as the 194 map system - maps are sent directly from the server to the client.

Read full topic

This isn’t using a program, it’s using actual code created by me, and already in the 317 client. It may not be completely customizable, but it’s definitely custom.

I know it looks bad, I could have made it look better, I was rushing at the time.

What do you mean custom walls? I can spawn walls wherever I want, lol.

item.title: Custom area i made real quick
item.dc:creator: @asshole_rule asshole_rule
item.description:
@asshole_rule wrote:

Jc22493:

I think we’re done arguing here.

I think of it more as debating. It’s not doing any harm, is it?

hadlich4:

Lol. Reading all this makes me laugh. i like to see all you all arguing about this although if you know another way to make a custom map for PI using a program etc. why don’t you show us how you do it and by “you” i mean the few who say they know a better way of doing this.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

This isn’t using a program, it’s using actual code created by me, and already in the 317 client. It may not be completely customizable, but it’s definitely custom.

If I knew how to model, I could make some way cooler stuff.

Edit:

I can’t help but feel like you think I’m totally against you and your map making. I’m actually 100% for it, and once again I say, I’m looking forward to seeing all your progress with this.

Read full topic

item.title: Custom area i made real quick
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

He already explained how he did it, and quite frankly its a fairly simple method.

hadlich4:

all i did was make a object in metaseq that looked like a tile and made it walkable, then custom spawned it where the player should be able to walk then i made the wall objects and made them not walkable and spawned them as well. i didnt use any map editor.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Teem_Rocket Teem_Rocket
item.description:
@Teem_Rocket wrote:

[quote=“rip4d, post:69, topic:522041”][quote author=Ambokile link=topic=640550.msg4328412#msg4328412 date=1373324315]
If it doesn’t display on the minimap, can it be classed as a map? I’m unsure
[/quote]That actually never occurred to me. I guess I’ve been away from RSPS for too long to remember that fact.

I guess this method could be intentionally used if you wanted to achieve an effect like in Barrows if you didn’t know how to black out the minimap for that area.[/quote]

That also locks the Mini-map.
